title.narrative: NAMA - Low Carbon Coffee - Costa Rica

description.narrative: Costa Rica’s NAMA Support Project (NSP) ‘Low Carbon Coffee’ aims at a climate-friendly transformation of the entire value chain of one of the most important economic sectors. It provides technical and policy advice to change production and processing practices in this sector which is the source of 10% of the country’s greenhouse gas emissions. Furthermore, the project incentivises private sector investments by providing grants, loans and guarantees for coffee farmers and millers to introduce greenhouse gas-efficient fertiliser and milling technologies. The project will contribute to the empowerment of farmers and millers to develop sustainable livelihoods, as well as maintain employment for up to 150,000 jobs during the harvest period, and may also create a positive impact on the standard of living of more than 400,000 people. The aggregate emission reduction potential amounts to 1.85 Mt CO2e over 20 years. Emission reductions of 250,000 tons CO2e are directly attributable to the NSP.
